props.name: id
props.description: Id of the avatar content wrapper element

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the avatar

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the avatar

props.name: avatarClass
props.description: Used to customize the avatar container

props.name: text
props.description: Text for the badge content

props.name: color
props.description: Color for the badge background

slots.name: default
slots.description: Slot for badge content, defaults to text prop

description:
this mixin provides the methods to automatically trap tab focus within
the component this mixin is on, meaning it is not possible to tab out
of the component without dismissing it. Useful for accessibility reasons
on things like important actionable alerts. Use focusFirstElement to
focus on the first tabbable element within your component, and call
focusTrappedTabPress every time tab is pressed to trap tab within this
component. Note that focusFirstElement WILL focus elements with tabindex="-1",
however focusTrappedTabPress will not.

props.name: titleId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the title element of the component. Useful for aria-describedby
or aria-labelledby or any other reason you may need an id to refer to the title.

props.name: contentId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the content element of the component. Useful for aria-describedby
or aria-labelledby or any other reason you may need an id to refer to the content.

props.name: title
props.description: Title header of the notice. This can be left blank to remove the title from the notice entirely.

props.name: important
props.description:
Used in scenarios where the message needs to visually dominate the screen.
 This will also change the aria role from status to alertdialog.
and will modally trap the keyboard focus in the dialog as soon as it displays.

props.name: pinned
props.description: Pins the banner to the top of the window and pushes all app content down.

props.name: kind
props.description: Severity level of the notice, sets the icon and background

props.name: closeButtonProps
props.description: Props for the notice close button.

props.name: hideClose
props.description: Hides the close button from the notice

slots.name: titleOverride
slots.description: Allows you to override the title, only use this if you need to override

slots.name: default
slots.description: the main textual content of the banner

slots.name: action
slots.description: Enter a possible action for the user to take, such as a link to another page

props.name: breadcrumbs
props.description: A provided list of breadcrumbs. Overridden by default slot

props.name: inverted
props.description: Passed through to link. If true, applies inverted styles to the link.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description: Descriptive label for the navigation content.

description: Base Vue component for Dialtone Buttons.

props.name: circle
props.description: Whether the button is a circle or not.

props.name: iconPosition
props.description: The position of the icon slot within the button.

props.name: importance
props.description: The fill and outline of the button associated with its visual importance.

props.name: link
props.description: Whether the button should be styled as a link or not.

props.name: linkKind
props.description: The color of the link and button if the button is styled as a link.

props.name: type
props.description: The HTML button type attribute.

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the button.

props.name: labelClass
props.description: Used to customize the label container

props.name: loading
props.description: Whether the button should display a loading animation or not.

props.name: kind
props.description: The color of the button.

props.name: assertiveOnFocus
props.description:
Determines whether a screenreader reads live updates of
the button content to the user while the button
is in focus. default is to not.

props.name: active
props.description:
Determines whether the button should have active styling
default is false.

props.name: alignment
props.description: Alignment of the buttons inside the container

description:
This mixin provides common logic shared amongst our groupable inputs.

This includes the group context and internal data attributes as well as a set common computed
properties and watchers. It also includes the group name warning logic.

props.name: label
props.description: A provided label for the input

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the input

props.name: v-model
props.description: Used to set the state of the checkable input

props.name: description
props.description: Describes the input

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disables the input

props.name: validationState
props.description: The validation state of the input

props.name: inputClass
props.description: Used to customize the input element

props.name: labelClass
props.description: Used to customize the label container

props.name: descriptionClass
props.description: Used to customize the description container

props.name: labelChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the label container

props.name: descriptionChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the description container

props.name: indeterminate
props.description: Indeterminate State, toggling indeterminate checkbox will uncheck

props.name: value
props.description: The value of the input

props.name: messagesClass
props.description: Used to customize the the validation messages component

props.name: messagesChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the validation messages component

props.name: showMessages
props.description: Used to hide / show the validation messages

props.name: messages
props.description: Validation messages

description:
This mixin provides a base provide obj and set of components, props, computed, watchers and data attributes that are
commonly used in our input group components.

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the input group

props.name: value
props.description: Not supported by this component, please use selectedValues

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the input group

props.name: legend
props.description: The legend of the input group

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disables the input group

props.name: messages
props.description: Validation messages

props.name: showMessages
props.description: Show validation messages

props.name: legendClass
props.description: Used to customize the legend element

props.name: messagesClass
props.description: Used to customize the messages container

props.name: legendChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the legend element

props.name: messagesChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the messages container

props.name: dataQaGroup
props.description: A data qa tag for the radio group

props.name: dataQaGroupLegend
props.description: A data qa tag for the radio group legend

props.name: dataQaGroupMessages
props.description: A data qa tag for the radio group messages

props.name: v-model
props.description: A provided list of selected values(s) for the checkbox group

props.name: closeButtonProps
props.description: A set of props to be passed into the modal's close button. Requires an 'ariaLabel' property.

props.name: hideClose
props.description: Hides the close button on the chip

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the chip.

props.name: interactive
props.description:
The interactivity of the chip.
Makes chip clickable, apply hover/focus/active style, emit keyboard events etc.

props.name: id
props.description: Id to use for the dialog's aria-labelledby.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description:
Descriptive label for the chip content.
If this prop is unset the content in the default slot will be used as an aria-label.

props.name: contentClass
props.description: Additional class name for the chip element.

props.name: listAriaLabel
props.description: String to use for the list's aria-label.

props.name: listId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the list element of the component. Used by several aria attributes
as well as when deriving the IDs for each item.

props.name: onBeginningOfList
props.description: A method that will be called when the selection goes past the beginning of the list.

props.name: onEndOfList
props.description: A method that will be called when the selection goes past the end of the list.

props.name: showList
props.description: Determines when to show the list element and also controls the aria-expanded attribute.

props.name: listRenderedOutside
props.description: If the list is rendered outside the component, like when using popover as the list wrapper.

props.name: loading
props.description: Determines when to show the skeletons and also controls aria-busy attribute.

props.name: emptyStateMessage
props.description: Message to show when the list is empty

events.name: highlight
events.description: Event fired when the highlight changes

events.name: opened
events.description: Event fired when list is shown or hidden

slots.name: input
slots.description: Slot for the combobox input element

slots.name: list
slots.description: Slot for the combobox list element

props.name: open
props.description:
Controls whether the dropdown is shown. Leaving this null will have the dropdown trigger on click by default.
If you set this value, the default trigger behavior will be disabled and you can control it as you need.
Supports .sync modifier

props.name: padding
props.description: Vertical padding size around the list element.

props.name: modal
props.description:
Determines modal state, dropdown has a modal overlay preventing interaction with elements
below it, but it is invisible.

props.name: contentWidth
props.description:
Width configuration for the popover content. When its value is 'anchor',
the popover content will have the same width as the anchor.

props.name: maxHeight
props.description:
Determines maximum height for the popover before overflow.
Possible units rem|px|em

props.name: maxWidth
props.description:
Determines maximum width for the popover before overflow.
Possible units rem|px|%|em

props.name: listId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the list element of the component. Used by several aria attributes
as well as when deriving the IDs for each item.

props.name: navigationType
props.description:
The type of navigation that this component should support.
- "arrow-keys" for items that are navigated with UP/DOWN keys.
- "tab" for items that are navigated using the TAB key.
- "none" for static items that are not interactive.

props.name: fallbackPlacements
props.description:
If the dropdown does not fit in the direction described by "placement",
it will attempt to change it's direction to the "fallbackPlacements".

props.name: placement
props.description: The direction the dropdown displays relative to the anchor.

props.name: onBeginningOfList
props.description: A method that will be called when the selection goes past the beginning of the list.

props.name: onEndOfList
props.description: A method that will be called when the selection goes past the end of the list.

props.name: listClass
props.description: Additional class for the wrapper list element.

events.name: highlight
events.description: Event fired when the highlight changes

events.name: opened
events.description: Emitted when dropdown is shown or hidden

slots.name: anchor
slots.description: Anchor element that activates the dropdown

props.name: code
props.description:
Supports shortcode ex: :smile: or unicode ex: ðŸ˜„. Will display the resulting emoji.
See https://emojipedia.org/joypixels/ for all supported shortcode/unicode or the docs
for setting up custom emojis.

props.name: size
props.description:
The size of the emoji. Can be any of the svg size utility
classes from https://dialpad.design/utilities/svg/size

props.name: imgClass
props.description:
Additional class name for the emoji img element.
Can accept all of String, Object, and Array, i.e. has the
same api as Vue's built-in handling of the class attribute.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description:
Will be read out on a screenreader for this emoji. You must use this prop if you want your emoji to be i18n
Compatible as Dialtone Vue will not translate it by itself. If you do not set this prop the aria-label will
be set to the english description of the emoji. You can retrieve the description for an emoji yourself via the
getEmojiJson() function

props.name: messagesClass
props.description: Used to customize the the validation messages component

props.name: messagesChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the validation messages component

props.name: showMessages
props.description: Used to hide / show the validation messages

props.name: messages
props.description: Validation messages

props.name: name
props.description: Name property of the input element

props.name: type
props.description:
Type of the input, one of `text`, `password`, `email`, `number`, `textarea`.
When `textarea` a `<textarea>` element will be rendered instead of an `<input>` element.

props.name: value
props.description: Value of the input

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disables the input

props.name: label
props.description: Label for the input

props.name: description
props.description: Description for the input

props.name: size
props.description: Size of the input, one of `xs`, `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`

props.name: iconSize
props.description:
Size of the icon. One of `xs`, `sm`, `md`, `lg`, `xl`. If you do not set this the icon will size relative
to the input size

props.name: inputClass
props.description:
Additional class name for the input element.
Can accept all of String, Object, and Array, i.e. has the
same api as Vue's built-in handling of the class attribute.

props.name: currentLength
props.description:
The current character length that the user has entered into the input.
This will only need to be used if you are using validate.length and
the string contains abnormal characters.
For example, an emoji could take up many characters in the input, but should only count as 1 character.
If no number is provided, a built-in length calculation will be used for the length validation.

props.name: validate
props.description:
Validation for the input. Supports maximum length validation with the structure:
`{ "length": {"description": string, "max": number, "warn": number, "message": string,
"limitMaxLength": boolean }}`

events.name: update:length
events.description: Length of the input when currentLength prop is not passed

slots.name: labelSlot
slots.description: slot for label, defaults to label prop

slots.name: description
slots.description: slot for description, defaults to description prop

description:
This mixin provides common logic shared amongst our groupable inputs.

This includes the group context and internal data attributes as well as a set common computed
properties and watchers. It also includes the group name warning logic.

props.name: label

props.description: The value of the input

props.name: description
props.description: Describes the input

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disables the input

props.name: validationState
props.description: The validation state of the input

props.name: inputClass
props.description: Used to customize the input element

props.name: labelClass
props.description: Used to customize the label container

props.name: descriptionClass
props.description: Used to customize the description container

props.name: labelChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the label container

props.name: descriptionChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the description container

description:
This mixin provides a base provide obj and set of components, props, computed, watchers and data attributes that are
commonly used in our input group components.

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the input group

props.name: value
props.description: The value of the input group

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the input group

props.name: legend
props.description: The legend of the input group

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disables the input group

props.name: messages
props.description: Validation messages

props.name: showMessages
props.description: Show validation messages

props.name: legendClass
props.description: Used to customize the legend element

props.name: messagesClass
props.description: Used to customize the messages container

props.name: legendChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the legend element

props.name: messagesChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the messages container

props.name: dataQaGroup
props.description: A data qa tag for the input group

props.name: dataQaGroupLegend
props.description: A data qa tag for the input group legend

props.name: dataQaGroupMessages
props.description: A data qa tag for the input group messages

props.name: show
props.description: Whether the child slot is shown.

props.name: transition
props.description: A valid Vue enter/leave CSS transition name.

props.name: kind
props.description: Applies the link variant styles

props.name: id
props.description: Id for the item.

props.name: role
props.description: String to use for the item's role.

props.name: elementType
props.description: The type of element to use for the wrapper.

props.name: type
props.description: The type of child list item to use.

props.name: navigationType
props.description:
The type of navigation that this component should support.
- "arrow-keys" for items that are navigated with UP/DOWN keys.
- "tab" for items that are navigated using the TAB key.
- "none" for static items that are not interactive.

description: Base Vue component for Dialtone Modal.

props.name: closeButtonProps
props.description: A set of props to be passed into the modal's close button. Requires an 'ariaLabel' property.

props.name: copy
props.description: Body text to display as the modal's main content.

props.name: describedById
props.description:
Id to use for the dialog's aria-describedby.
Recommended only if the dialog content itself isn't enough to give full context,
as screen readers should recite the dialog contents by default before any aria-description.

props.name: labelledById
props.description: Id to use for the dialog's aria-labelledby.

props.name: show
props.description: Whether the modal should be shown.  Parent component can sync on this value to control the modal's visibility.

props.name: title
props.description: Title text to display in the modal header.

props.name: kind
props.description: The theme of the modal.
values:
default or danger
kind - default or danger (https://dialpad.design/components/modal/)

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the modal.
values:
default or full
size - default or full (https://dialpad.design/components/modal/)

props.name: modalClass
props.description:
Additional class name for the root modal element.
Can accept all of String, Object, and Array, i.e. has the
same api as Vue's built-in handling of the class attribute.

props.name: dialogClass
props.description:
Additional class name for the dialog element within the modal.
Can accept all of String, Object, and Array, i.e. has the
same api as Vue's built-in handling of the class attribute.

props.name: hideClose
props.description: Hides the close button on the modal

props.name: fixedHeaderFooter
props.description: Scrollable modal that allows scroll the modal content keeping the header and footer fixed

events.name: update:show
events.description:
The modal will emit a "false" boolean value for this event when the user performs a modal-closing action.
Parent components can sync on this value to create a 2-way binding to control modal visibility.

slots.name: header
slots.description: Slot for dialog header section, taking the place of any "title" text prop

slots.name: default
slots.description: Default slot for dialog body section, taking the place of any "copy" text prop

slots.name: footer
slots.description: Slot for dialog footer content, often containing cancel and confirm buttons.

props.name: titleId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the title element of the component. Useful for aria-describedby
or aria-labelledby or any other reason you may need an id to refer to the title.

props.name: contentId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the content element of the component. Useful for aria-describedby
or aria-labelledby or any other reason you may need an id to refer to the content.

props.name: title
props.description: Title header of the notice. This can be left blank to remove the title from the notice entirely.

props.name: role
props.description:
Provides a role for the notice. 'status' is used to communicate a message. 'alert' is used to communicate an
important message that does not contain any interactive elements. 'alertdialog' is used to communicate an
important message that does contain interactive elements.

props.name: important
props.description:
Used in scenarios where the message needs to visually dominate the screen.
This will also change the aria role from status to alert.

props.name: kind
props.description: Severity level of the notice, sets the icon and background

props.name: closeButtonProps
props.description: Props for the notice close button.

props.name: hideClose
props.description: Hides the close button from the notice

slots.name: titleOverride
slots.description: Allows you to override the title, only use this if you need

slots.name: default
slots.description: the main textual content of the notice

slots.name: action
slots.description: Enter a possible action for the user to take, such as a link to another page

description:
this mixin provides the methods to automatically trap tab focus within
the component this mixin is on, meaning it is not possible to tab out
of the component without dismissing it. Useful for accessibility reasons
on things like important actionable alerts. Use focusFirstElement to
focus on the first tabbable element within your component, and call
focusTrappedTabPress every time tab is pressed to trap tab within this
component. Note that focusFirstElement WILL focus elements with tabindex="-1",
however focusTrappedTabPress will not.

props.name: open
props.description:
Controls whether the popover is shown. Leaving this null will have the popover trigger on click by default.
If you set this value, the default trigger behavior will be disabled and you can control it as you need.
Supports .sync modifier

props.name: elementType
props.description: Element type (tag name) of the root element of the component.

props.name: transition
props.description: Named transition when the content display is toggled.

props.name: role
props.description: ARIA role for the content of the popover. Defaults to "dialog".

props.name: ariaLabelledby
props.description:
ID of the element that serves as the label for the popover content.
Defaults to the "anchor" element; this exists to provide a different
ID of the label element if, for example, the anchor slot contains
other items that do not serve as a label. You should provide this
or ariaLabel, but not both.

props.name: ariaLabel
props.description:
Descriptive label for the popover content. You should provide this
or ariaLabelledby, but not both.

props.name: closeButtonProps
props.description:
A set of props to be passed into the popover's header close button.
Requires an 'ariaLabel' property, when the header popover is visible

props.name: padding
props.description: Padding size class for the popover content.

props.name: contentClass
props.description: Additional class name for the content wrapper element.

props.name: contentWidth
props.description:
Width configuration for the popover content. When its value is 'anchor',
the popover content will have the same width as the anchor.

props.name: contentTabindex
props.description: Tabindex value for the content. Passing null, no tabindex attribute will be set.

props.name: externalAnchor
props.description:
External anchor id to use in those cases the anchor can't be provided via the slot.
For instance, using the combobox's input as the anchor for the popover.

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the tooltip

props.name: offset
props.description:
Displaces the content box from its anchor element
 by the specified number of pixels.

props.name: hideOnClick
props.description:
Determines if the popover hides upon clicking the
anchor or outside of the content box.

props.name: modal
props.description:
Determines modal state. If enabled popover has a modal overlay
preventing interaction with elements below it, but it is invisible.

props.name: fallbackPlacements
props.description:
If the popover does not fit in the direction described by "placement",
it will attempt to change it's direction to the "fallbackPlacements".

props.name: placement
props.description: The direction the popover displays relative to the anchor.

props.name: tether
props.description:
If set to false the dialog will display over top of the anchor when there is insufficient space.
If set to true it will never move from its position relative to the anchor and will clip instead.

props.name: sticky
props.description:
If the popover sticks to the anchor. This is usually not needed, but can be needed
if the reference element's position is animating, or to automatically update the popover
position in those cases the DOM layout changes the reference element's position.
`true` enables it, `reference` only checks the "reference" rect for changes and `popper` only
checks the "popper" rect for changes.

props.name: maxHeight
props.description:
Determines maximum height for the popover before overflow.
Possible units rem|px|em

props.name: maxWidth
props.description:
Determines maximum width for the popover before overflow.
Possible units rem|px|%|em

props.name: showCloseButton
props.description: Determines visibility for close button

props.name: headerClass
props.description: Additional class name for the header content wrapper element.

props.name: footerClass
props.description: Additional class name for the footer content wrapper element.

props.name: dialogClass
props.description: Additional class name for the dialog element.

props.name: initialFocusElement
props.description:
The element that is focused when the popover is opened. This can be an
HTMLElement within the popover, a string starting with '#' which will
find the element by ID. 'first' which will automatically focus
the first element, or 'dialog' which will focus the dialog window itself.
If the dialog is modal this prop cannot be 'none'.

props.name: openWithArrowKeys
props.description:
If the popover should open pressing up or down arrow key on the anchor element.
This can be set when not passing open prop.

events.name: opened
events.description: Emitted when popover is shown or hidden

slots.name: anchor
slots.description: Anchor element that activates the popover. Usually a button.

slots.name: content
slots.description: content that is displayed in the popover when it is open.

This includes the group context and internal data attributes as well as a set common computed
properties and watchers. It also includes the group name warning logic.

props.description: Describes the input

props.description: Disables the input

props.description: A set of props that are passed into the description container

props.name: label
props.description: Label for the select

props.name: description
props.description: Description for the select

props.name: options
props.description:
Select Menu Options, overridden by default slot. Each option has the following structure:
`{ index: number (optional), value: number || string (required), label: string (required) }`

params.title: param
params.name: options
params.description: Optional - A list that can be used to create a list of select menu options

params.title: param
params.name: options
params.description: [].index - Optional - The index of the option

props.name: size
props.description: Controls the size of the select

props.name: labelClass
props.description: Used to customize the label container

props.name: descriptionClass
props.description: Used to customize the description container

props.name: selectClass
props.description: Used to customize the select

props.name: optionClass
props.description: Used to customize each option, should options be provided via prop

props.name: labelChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the label container

props.name: descriptionChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into the description container

props.name: optionChildProps
props.description: A set of props that are passed into each option, should options be provided via prop

props.name: disabled
props.description: Disabled state of the select

slots.name: label
slots.description: Slot for label, defaults to label prop

slots.name: description
slots.description: Slot for description, defaults to description prop

slots.name: default
slots.description: Slot for select menu options, defaults to options prop

props.name: titleId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the title element of the component. Useful for aria-describedby
or aria-labelledby or any other reason you may need an id to refer to the title.

props.name: contentId
props.description:
Sets an ID on the content element of the component. Useful for aria-describedby
or aria-labelledby or any other reason you may need an id to refer to the content.

props.name: title
props.description: Title header of the toast. This can be left blank to remove the title from the toast entirely.

props.name: message
props.description: Message of the toast. Overridden by default slot.

props.name: role
props.description:
Provides a role for the toast. 'status' is used by default to communicate a message. 'alert' is used to
communicate an important message like an error that does not contain any interactive elements.

props.name: kind
props.description: Severity level of the toast, sets the icon and background

props.name: important
props.description: Used in scenarios where the message needs to visually dominate the screen.

props.name: show
props.description:
Controls whether the toast is shown. If a valid duration is provided, the toast will disappear
after reaching the duration time, so it's convenient to use `.sync` modifier with this prop to update
the data in your component.
Supports .sync modifier

props.name: closeButtonProps
props.description: Props for the toast close button.

props.name: hideClose
props.description: Hides the close button from the toast

props.name: duration
props.description:
The duration in ms the toast will display before disappearing.
The toast won't disappear if the duration is not provided.
If it's provided, it should be equal to or greater than 6000.

slots.name: titleOverride
slots.description: Allows you to override the title, only use this if you need to override

slots.name: default
slots.description: the main textual content of the toast

slots.name: action
slots.description: Enter a possible action for the user to take, such as a link to another page

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the tooltip

props.name: fallbackPlacements
props.description:
If the popover does not fit in the direction described by "placement",
it will attempt to change it's direction to the "fallbackPlacements"
if defined, otherwise it will automatically position to a new location
as it sees best fit.

props.name: inverted
props.description: Add inverted class

props.name: offset
props.description:
Displaces the tooltip from its reference element
 by the specified number of pixels.

props.name: placement
props.description: The direction the popover displays relative to the anchor.

props.name: sticky
props.description:
If the tooltip sticks to the anchor. This is usually not needed, but can be needed
if the reference element's position is animating, or to automatically update the popover
position in those cases the DOM layout changes the reference element's position.
`true` enables it, `reference` only checks the "reference" rect for changes and `popper` only
checks the "popper" rect for changes.

props.name: contentClass
props.description:
Additional css classes for the tooltip content element.
Can accept all of String, Object, and Array, i.e. has the
same api as Vue's built-in handling of the class attribute.

props.name: message
props.description: A provided message for the tooltip content

props.name: show
props.description:
Controls whether the tooltip is shown. Leaving this null will have the tooltip trigger on mouseover by default.
If you set this value, the default mouseover behavior will be disabled and you can control it as you need.
Supports .sync modifier

props.name: transition
props.description: Named transition when the content display is toggled.

events.name: shown
events.description: Emitted when tooltip is shown or hidden

props.name: id
props.description: The id of the validation message

props.name: validationMessages
props.description:
Array of validation messages. Each message has the following structure:
`{ message: "Some informative message", type: "error|warning|success"}`

props.name: showMessages
props.description: Show Validation messages
